intro: Tetratheca elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mulla mulla, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Tetratheca elliptica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
